Generation V.Black: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.
Generation V.White: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.
Generation V.Black 2: When it moves rhythmically, it makes a sound similar to maracas, making the surprised Pokémon flee.
Generation V.White 2: When it moves rhythmically, it makes a sound similar to maracas, making the surprised Pokémon flee.

Generation VI.X: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.
Generation VI.Y: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It uses an up-tempo song and dance to drive away the bird Pokémon that prey on its flower seeds.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: Arid regions are their habitat. They move rhythmically, making a sound similar to maracas.

Generation VIII.Sword: With noises that could be mistaken for the rattles of maracas, it creates an upbeat rhythm, startling bird Pokémon and making them fly off in a hurry.
Generation VIII.Shield: Once each year, this Pokémon scatters its seeds. They're jam-packed with nutrients, making them a precious food source out in the desert.

Generation VIII.Sword: Route 6 , Bridge Field , Stony Wilderness , Hammerlocke Hills Dappled Grove , Giant's Mirror ( Max Raid Battle )
